data.title: Serialize Image to DDS
data.body:
It looks strange for me that Image could be read from DDS but couldn't be written to.
I suggest to add SaveDDS method and maybe SerializeDDS(Serializer&).
I am trying to implement is on my own but I am afraid that I can do something wrong because Deserialize logic is quite complicated.

data.title: DXT1 Image Decompression Issue
Inverse Square light falloff
data.body: This is a physically correct model for the falloff of light dependent on the range of the light. its a simple implementation equal performance to the current fall off solution. The downside/ reason i bring it up is the current Implementation replaces the texture based solution, i dont want to sync time into the changes if they are not merged to master as i dont have a person need for it.

data.title: PBR Major improvements
data.body: A small commit that improves the quality of the current PBR implementation. Changes include Gamma correction to ensure the color and brightness of materials. I also made some changes to the demo scene that includes, pre-filtered skybox and zone texture along with a new floor texture that prefer.

data.title: Normal comment to doxygen comment.
data.body: sorry for this second pull-request. i've found the same issue in another file but my previous pull-request was already merged.

data.title: CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR -> Urho3D_SOURCE_DIR
data.body: This change makes Urho3D no longer assume it "owns the world". While `CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR` always points to directory of root project, `Urho3D_SOURCE_DIR` always points to directory of Urho3D project. Under normal circumstances these both values are equal so it has no impact on build at all. However it paves a way for using Urho3D with `add_subdirectory()` as a child of other project in the future.

data.title: Make usage of Urho3D/include folder optional
data.body:
For now Urho3D have to be used through **Urho3D_build/include/Urho3D** folder.

Pros:
- Clean include folder

Cons:
- Two copies of includes that have to be synchronized if symlinking isn't acceptable.
- _Ruined code navigation like go-to-source and go-to-definition_. This is the worst thing that could happen when I investigate smbd's code.

I even can't use **Urho3D_src/source/Urho3D** without extra work because this folder have no Urho3D.h

I suggest to _allow_ to use **Urho3D_src/source/Urho3D** as include folder.

data.body: The newly commits (possible the commit of https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/commit/b24bcb89282c2333c3b2a53d6ad423046be958d3) makes the particle effect appearance look different: The particle effect is from https://github.com/LucKeyProductions/heXon/blob/master/Resources/Particles/BloodDrip.xml Before: After: After the commit, the color becomes darker and some black.

in FileSystem.cpp line  644 in DirExists function

```
            parentPath = assetPath.Substring(0, pos - 1);
```

Of by 1 error. Should be


dang of by ones lol

data.title: ParticleEffect has no clone method
data.body: Material has cloneMaterial method, but ParticleEffect has no such method.

data.title: Optimize direction billboard vertex buffer
data.body: After developing RibbonTrail feature, I realized it's no longer need to passing camera position to direction billboard vertex buffer because Urho3D already has default uniform to do the job.

data.title: No connection:delete() in Lua API
data.body: Writing networking code can be hard so some people might choose to write it in Lua to make it easier to prototype. However, there is no connection:delet() binding to ~Connection() destructor, so this will occupy more memory as more clients join and disconnect. The https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/bin/Data/LuaScripts/17_SceneReplication.lua example simply uses table.remove to get rid of the connection object, hoping it will be garbage collected by Lua.

data.title: Create RenderPath that renders n-th output of gbuffer
data.body:
Ok, I found pretty good solution

```
<renderpath>
    <rendertarget name="stub1" sizedivisor="1 1" format="rgba" />
    <rendertarget name="stub2" sizedivisor="1 1" format="rgba" />
    <rendertarget name="depth" sizedivisor="1 1" format="readabledepth" />
    <command type="clear" color="0 0 0 0" depth="1.0" stencil="0" depthstencil="depth" />
    <command type="scenepass" pass="deferred" marktostencil="true" vertexlights="true" metadata="gbuffer" depthstencil="depth">
        <output index="0" name="stub1" />
        <output index="1" name="stub2" />
        <output index="2" name="viewport" />
    </command>
</renderpath>
```

data.title: Shadow Maps Optimization
data.body:
Hello,

Currently shadow maps rendering consume a lot of performances. For games that need a "lot" of light sources this is very problematic as the shadow maps are rendered every frames. With just 3 point light the frame rate is dropping quite a bit and this is sad because the rest of the engine is quite well optimized :)

A basic idea would be to have flags on each drawables, those flags would be for example: 

LIGHT_DYNAMIC
LIGHT_STATIC

Two shadow maps would be generated for each spot and point lights source. and the idea is to only draw the shadow map when needed based on those flags and when the drawables are moving. So the shadows are not drawn every frames like it is now.

This optimization is explained here: http://www.leadwerks.com/werkspace/blog/1/entry-114-double-buffered-shadow-maps/

I have tested this optimization in leadwerks engine in the past, before and after and the performance gain was very noticeable.

I can't handle this work myself as i miss some knowledge on the subject but i would be very happy if Cadaver could try it. I think it's very important to optimize shadow rendering as it have a too big impact on performances for now :) 

What is your opinion about it @cadaver ? 

Thank you

I know that editor in Urho3D is just script plugin over engine.
However, I am looking for some way to draw in Editor some simple _textured_ geometry related to some node that should be invisible during normal rendering.
How can I do it?

data.title: Minor changes in Container
data.body:
I suggest some changes in Urho3D.Container that I found useful during writing some code that uses Urho3D as C++ library.
1. Add nullptr_t ctors to SharedPtr and WeakPtr (guarded by URHO3D_CXX11). This allows to write `foo(nullptr)` or `return nullptr` instead of `return SharedPtr<SomeClass>()`
2. Add aggregate ctor to PODVector (guarded by URHO3D_CXX11). It looks strange that Vector has aggregate ctor but PODVector doesn't.
3. Make [POD]Vector::Buffer() public. It allows to get rid of ugly `foo(&vec[0], vec.Size())` and _it prevents asserts if vector is empty_.

If you accept [some of] these changes I'll make PR.

Incorrect Text attribute (class Text)
data.body:
Instead URHO3D_ATTRIBUTE("Text", String, text_, String::EMPTY, AM_FILE);
should be URHO3D_ACCESSOR_ATTRIBUTE("Text", GetText,SetText

becose when loading:

```
        <element type="Text" style="ButtonText">
            <attribute name="Auto Localizable" value="true" />
            <attribute name="Text" value="START!" />
        </element>
```

stringId_ still emty and text_ cleared when language is changed.
